er_text: The burger was excellent. Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had. They have curly fries which everyone seems to love. I ordered the black burger which was about $6 with curly fries and a water. I spent a little over $11. These are like 5 Guys and Shake Shack burgers. The space is pretty small. It seats about 7 people comfortably. There is street parking. It is located in between the hardware store and poke bowl spot. Next time I am in Tribeca, I will definitely visit this location.

I've been to this Black Burger a while back to only try their milkshakes and I thought they were delicious. I paid another visit back here after I was in the area tonight and I decided to order the black burger with cheese and everything (lettuce, tomato, pickle, onion), curly fries and a chocolate shake. Burger was nicely seasoned, fries were nice and crispy, and the milkshake, again, was delicious. I'd suggest however, that they toast the buns a little longer as my bun partially disintegrated as I was holding it. I had my burger done medium rare and it was pretty juicy and decent. Not the best burger I've ever had, but it'll do.

I GOT VERY SICK All I ate yesterday was a salad that I made in the morning, and a black burger with fries in the evening. Prior to yesterday I only had home cooked food from which no one else felt Ill. I have been miserable and bed ridden all day with food poisoning. I think that it is from this burger. I started feeling nauseous a few hours after eating here.  I have been very very sick all day. I almost went to the hospital. 12 hours later and I still feel like I'm going to die. I regret eating here. I have never gotten sick like this from a New York restaurant and I saw some other reviews that said they got food poisoning too, some had to be hospitalized and had a very high fever like me. Some got pushed to not recommended below. You have no idea how sick I am.

Ho man. What a solid choice for a well prepared, tasty burger in the late hours after a night out. The Jack Black, full of bacon, pepper jack, and onion rings, figuratively knocked my proverbial socks off. They cooked it medium per my request and the whole sandwich was a succulent indulgence. When can I go back to Tribeca!

I thought this place was really good. I ordered the jalapeno burger with pepper jack cheese. My burger was cooked exactly as I ordered. This was my first time at this restaurant and I recommend people give it a try. They have these really great curly fries and the portion is pretty big. I could not finish all of them. My order with a drink came to around $13 but for a freshly cooked burger and hot fries it's worth it lol.

If I had dropped a tip in the jar after my order, I would have taken it back after my order arrived. The two guys that look exactly alike, brothers I'm told are about the most unprofessional pair of cackling hyenas I've ever endured, these two momo's are cooking and working directly in front of the customers behaving like that.Not one single word in English was used at any point during my time inside, I couldn't wait to get out of there and I should have -- right then and there. At no point did they stop the incessant and ear piercing offensive loudness of yelling and the counter girl and the box folder gladly joined in, modulating the other to sacrificial levels. Horrible behavior --- that is, anywhere in the civilized world.Now ---  I could care less about the certified beef you use and tracking the meat all the way to the moon and back or wherever it began.  Who really cares when your so poorly treated, why would I care? The beef in the Double Black Burger was far from special, or even average, indicating to me that what they sell may be different from what they promote. And the cast of misfits really puts an emphasis on even the smaller, seemingly inconsquential problems. Eg1: unclean floors, torn seat covers, cheap napkins, gummy floors, sticky counter, slimy sauce bottles, you get the point.The cheap bun fell apart in a moment upon any contact with any of the other parts, wet bun, wet lettuce wet burger, wet foil. This place is all wet and would never be a consideration again.Yet -- The title of Worst Burger and Worst Staff? Well --- that's too easy... Its this dump, and I can't wait to move that information down the Yelp line to all my buddies in forewarning.

Heard great things about them and decided to try them out for lunch today and to my surprise they have daily special offers for lunch! Love that, esp. Since most people including myself get sick of eating the same thing all the time near the job.Come in with fast food expectations and not restaurant expectations and you won't be disappointed; it just costs more than your McDonalds and Burger Kings.Food:The burgers are freshly made on the spot and delicious and the size is smaller than a whopper. Their sodas are self service for refills and they cant seat much people if you are thinking about the dine in experience. I heard they're milkshakes are pretty good, esp the strawberry flavor and they give large portions for fries. So I will have to come back to try those and see for my self.

When in TriBeCa and need a quick burger this is where I come. I usually order the black with cheese as a combo with all the free works lettuce, tomato, special sauce, pickles, & onions. The combo comes with seasoned curly fries & a refillable fountain drink. The burgers are not fancy but they are good. The space is minimal standing/sitting window counter space. I think the place seats 6-8 people semi comfortably. Pretty much eat and go or just to go place. The staff is friendly, the price point is reasonable for TriBeCa. Check it out if you need a quick burger and happen to be in the area. Again, if you happen to be in the area.

SO GOOD. Reminds me of one of my favorite restaurants back home, but better!I had my boyfriend pick it up for me while on his way home from work. I ordered a Philly burger with a side of curly fries. By the time he made it to Williamsburg (20 min) commute, the food was still warm and my curly fries were still crispy and crunchy! They gave me 5-6 packets of ketchup( I hate when I'm lacking extra condiments  with my Togo order). My burger was medium rare( perfectly cooked) and it was covered in melted cheese, mushrooms and sautéed veggies.I left no trace of deliciousness in that white box. All around wholesome greasy burger and best fries!

Holy moly, I came here at 2am last night to get some after drink munchies. I am a big burger fan and this place had so much to offer! The order was placed easily online then we picked it up. I decided to have the Mexican burger with curly fries. The burger was cooked medium well as I wanted and seasoned to perfection. I love spicy food, so this burger did not disappoint. It was flavorful and spicy. The special sauce they use is amazing, I slathered my fries with it and it was so gooooooodd. I wish they had more locations! I will def come back to get a quick burger fix, and the meal is reasonable price!

Lunch time summons a quality burger which Black Burger upholds to the quality, and juicy flavor. One black burger with cheese, lettuce, and tomato $5.99 was perfectly cooked medium without any dryness but abundant flavor.  I desired red onions on my burger.  The bun was plain and boring supermarket mass produced and purchased cheaply.  My predilection is either brioche bread or sourdough bread.  One bottle water $2.49 was surely overpriced indeed.  Customer service is average but efficient without the ignore or apathetic cavalier attitude that I have grown so accustomed and intolerable.  I would like to try their curly fries as it is something that I highly covet.Extremely limited seating which does not meet the NYC law requirement of providing facilities to patrons.

Walked past on a rainy day, and the smells coming out brought me in. I had the Ranch Burger with a veggie patty with curly fries. I did t realize how hungry I was till I looked down & saw the burger & half the fries had disappeared!   Each bite was better than the rest! I wish I would have found this place sooner!

Splendid service, brilliant milkshakes and amazing burgers. Curled fries are great also. It is an affordable and nice diner/lunch place. Milkshakes are thick and tasty, burgers are also flavorfull. Would certainly recommend.

So here's the deal - burger meat was meh - but the amount of bacon, crispness of the lettuce, and the rest of the toppings in this chipotle party made the burger yum. Had the Chipotle Thursday special - includes drink and curly fries for $9.99 cannot be beat - worth hitting this place up if you're in the vicinity and wanting a sloppy burger. Curly fries were also very yummy crispy on the outside - balanced by the soft inside. Staff was pleasant, courteous and helpful. All in all a good experience. I'll be back.

Stopped by this place for a quick treat today while on a break from work. Already ate lunch, so decided to order a strawberry milkshake. While waiting, I noticed the aroma of juicy burgers cooking and fries sizzling.  My strawberry shake was done pretty quickly and looked like a dream. I opted not to have whipped cream, but the cashier made sure there was extra strawberry sauce in my shake. The shake itself had real strawberries and I loved that it also had the rich taste of ice cream. Perfect treat! One thing about the place that causes me to take off a star is that it is comically small in size. This is not a place where you can bring your friends for dinner, as there are only five seats scattered around the counter space.

Stopped at Black Burger to grab some dinner before my long evening class.  I ordered the regular cheeseburger combo which comes with curly fries and a fountain drink.  I did not have to wait very long for my food.  While I waited, I checked out the menu further and planned which burger I'm gonna have next!  They all sound so good.  They also serve shakes and a variety of bottled beverages here.  There is limited bar seating if you would like to eat your food there.I asked for my burger to be medium and it was cooked perfectly.  The curly fries were seasoned well also.  Black Burger is a great choice for a delicious burger without the crazy wait time or price like another place in the area.If you're ever in the area check this place out.  You will not be disappointed.
So simple but yet so delicious! When a burger and curly fries are what you are hungry for come to this place. Quick service for walk ins or ordering online plus friendly staff.

When it is after midnight (they close at 3 am) and you want a burger, Black Burger doesn't disappoint.  A quick walk from our hotel, the space itself is rather small with a few bar stools to eat in house.  But you don't come here for the atmosphere but for a damn good burger for a damn good price.  I opted for the Double Black with Cheese.  Cooked to order while you wait, the burger was massive and just the right amount of grease coming out of the never frozen patties to make it a guilty treat.  The only negative is that the burger could have been seasoned more.  Super friendly staff.  Definitely a great find.

I was in the area completing a continuing legal education course and had to grab a quick bite to-go before getting on the bus. Thanks to my handy dandy yelp app ;-)  I found this place right around the corner from the law school. I came on a Sunday night around 6 pm. It was mostly empty. I ordered the black burger with cheese.  It was a single patty and came with lettuce and tomato. I also added mushrooms and jalapeños. So good! The sauce was so flavorful i didn't even need ketchup. I also had the curly fries which were good also. The cashier was awesome. He was so friendly and personable. My food took about 10 minutes or so and was packed in a convenient box. Definitely a quality burger spot.

This place is great for quick and moderately priced eats! AND.....they DELIVER YAY. I usually get a Black Burger with blue cheese, well done, with bacon. I ALWAYS get the milkshakes. The banana one is my fave because they actually use real bananas, milk and ice team to make them. Please can get very crowded around lunch time as this is the only "good" burger spot in the Canal street area. Unless you wanna go to Burger King or Mc Donald's lol. Fair pricing, free drink refills, limited seating. But still a great place to chow down. Plus there's a park nearby and benches out front so I don't mind taking my burger to go sometimes.

Nothing to special about their burger. I thought it was going to be a burger joint that had a unique taste. It was a normal burger. Fortunately, pricing was fair, so I didn't have to waste much money to find out

This place is outstanding if you want the finest hockey pucks in the city. McDonald's burgers have more flavor then these things. The wait was unusually long for a fast food style place and the idea of putting my burger in a box isn't the brightest. It resulted in everything falling apart and being a mess. The entire burger tasted as if it wasn't fresh, they claim they don't use frozen burgers which might be true but this didn't look or taste like a fresh burger. The prices here are not fast food level but the quality of the food was lower then fast food quality.I don't have much to say about the fries other then "meh" because I lost my appetite way before I could eat enough of them to decide whether I liked them or not. Maybe it was just that one burger (or two since my girlfriend felt the same way) but black burger was definitely more like a bad burger during my visit.Free combos won't tempt me to try the food again eitherResponding to the owner: this is my review I am an individual person so if we both posted a review that's two separate people reviewing the business. The food simply wasn't good, and if I didn't like it the first time I won't like it a second time. I'll give you two stars since you seem upset, while it is true you have 4 stars at your establishments, you don't have 5 which means I am not the only one to give you a less then perfect review. Then again one review won't make a huge difference now will it. As for what was wrong with the food it was dry and tasteless and it made both of us feel sick to our stomachs perhaps it was bad meat or it wasn't cooked properly but I'm not the guy at the grill so I don't know what went wrong.

Solid burger. It's not the juiciest or the most flavorful burger, but I've had worse burgers than this, but also much better burgers.  For the price point, it's pretty decent value and the curly fries were on point if that means anything.
Big, greasy, somewhat-uninspired burgers that won't break the bank. The service was smooth and friendly (contrary to some reviews) but the food won't have you rushing back.
Really good burger and very filling :) had the philly burger with curly fries - definitely recommend

We stopped here after a long day in NY didn't know what to expect but it was pretty good. We got a Wednesday special and for the price the food you get is just enough. Ate better burgers but over all a good quick burger, better then some Wendy's ha
Amazing burgers! I'm a vegeterian so it's never easy to find a good burger place in the city. But this is a gem of a place for burgers and shakes.Definitely recommend!!!

Nothing super innovative, just solid burgers/shakes/sides.  This isn't the place you go out of your way to come to try, but if you're in the neighborhood and looking for some good eats, give it a shot.
I tried a Black Burger with extra mushrooms and it didn't disappoint. Super satisfying lunch spot if you're in the area.

This review is solely for my experience today. BB is a block away from my work and I have been here several times in the past. I have the veggie burger and curly fries and they are hit and miss most of the times. But not too bad. To say that the service is okay... would be exaggerating. It depends on who you get behind the counter taking your order and / or what mood they are in.Today I walked in and ordered an Avocado milkshake, their 'new' milkshake as advertised outside the doors: a green looking cool drink! So I ordered that and waited for almost 10-15 minutes! Several people ordered after me and got their food while I waited for one drink. I had to remind the server behind the counter, who then sluggishly started putting the drink together. I asked him something and I am not sure if he mumbled or chose to ignore me completely as he just started talking to the next customer. When you offer an avocado milkshake, please teach your staff how to prepare it. He put the whole avocado, with skin in the blender! Half way through, I got so disgusted with pieces of the tough skin in my mouth that I had to throw my drink away.

Good burgers. Kinda pushy with the review process for Yelp...  Good food either way!! Yummy...10/10 I've been back to this place and not much has changed for the better. Lost a star since then. They have neglected the cleanliness of the location and keep the doors open so lots of bugs would swarm in. Not comfortable to stay or eat when thinking what may have touched different components of the food while they wait for the next order (ew). Buyer beware

I was just looking for a quick bite in TriBeCa, and I stumbled into Black Burger.  The basic hamburger here is five stars. When you order a $5 buck burger, and they ask you how you want it cooked--you know you are getting something better than average.  I don't know if this is a chain or a one off, but it is fantastic.  I will come all the way down here regularly just for lunch.

I don't really eat burgers so it's kind of hard to judge a burger place but I got a grilled cheese and cheesy curly fries. The grilled cheese was alright, good for the price. The cheese fries were delicious.
They have their good days and bad days. I eat here pretty frequently cause I'm in the area alot  but yea . I hope you catch them on a good day.

This place has GOOD BURGERS. And curly fries too!! My husband and I had an hour for a quick lunch date and walked in here. In the 20 minutes it took us to eat, neither of us said a word to one another. It's reasonably priced, and the food is super yummy. Not a ton of space to sit/stay and eat (only 5 or 6 counter seats) so make sure you have a backup place to eat just in case they're busy.
Such a good burger spot, it's small but don't be deceived. The burger might look basic but trust me when I tell you, it's heavenly.

You probably WON'T want to eat here WHEN school is in session and it's time for kids to go home BECAUSE there's a bunch of kids outside acting foolish, shouting, running in and out of the restaurant and play fighting against the glass.  The staff didn't seem to mind, which tells me that this is normal at these times. Besides that lil craze happening outside, the flavors happening inside the store is just as craaazy!  The Hawaiian burger is pretty good, but the teriyaki sauce in the burger is a little too much.  I recommend you ask for it on the side of possible.  You can also say how you'd like your burger cooked which is cool.  The beef is nothing crazy, just regular beef -- decent quality. The curly fries(regular size) is good enough for 2 people.  And I ate a meal with free water, for just under $10.  This spot is nice, for a grub, and go.  Choose your time to visit wisely!  4 STARS!

this will be quick. the burgers aren't bad. tbh they weren't that memorable, but they're big. i remember that much. but those cheese curly fries are everything. skip the mozz sticks. they also serve milkshakes. it's a tight little spot west of broadway, but legit have the best fries in the area.

Literally searched for a place on Canal St. on Yelp and this was #1 so my boyfriend and I just decided to spontaneously try it. Their burgers are delicious and they ask you how you want your burger done. Paid $19 for the black burger w/ cheese, the chipotle burger, curly fries (yum!), and refillable soda! Also surprised we found seating inside.
One of the best burgers I've had in Tribeca area. Especially the ranch black angus burger is my favorite. The curly fries are one of the specialties and a must have whenever you visit.
Best burger in Soho.Curly Fries are really great :)And also Jack black burger was so yummy.

One of the few spots open late thru the night - if you crave for a hot burger and a mess of fries. Hardly a spot where you would sit down and eat, since it appears to be 99% carry out, I noticed plenty of Uber eats in & out of the place. I tried the regular black burger with curly fries and a soda. It was was overall not bad at all. A tad on the greasy side, but at 11pm, perhaps that is what you want. I should have checked their special (tacked on the wall away from the main menu). When I am in the area again will visit one more time.
On par for the priceNothing to write home aboutJust fast and decent

When I say loveeeee.... I couldn't even get a proper picture of the burger without tearing into it first. It's really good, I order the bacon Black with sautéed onions and I'm very happy with my decision. It's delicious! If you're in the soho area I definitely suggest stopping by for a bite. It's tiny but you can eat in or take out.
Best turkey ever burgers around I would def recommend to all my family and friends Turkey burgers !!!!
Great burgers, delicious curly fries. I will recommend this place and will definitely come back.
A great quick and delicious burger make sure you come here before you hurt your pockets on a mediocre burger!

I'm really disappointed. After years going to this restaurant I went with my senior friend who bought a bacon burger. After pay, my friend saw the add offering the same product she ordered, but cheaper. She asked for the cashier, but the lady was really rude with her. We asked her name so we could complain with the manager, but she refused to answer and said she is the manager. Really disappointed, what kind of manager is so rude with costumers?

The Dependable burger and fries joint that's made anyway you want it fast. They have beef, turkey, veggie and chicken "burgers". The curly fries are pretty awesome and they give you plenty. The shakes are thick and delicious.
It was good but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected it to be. I also had the mozzarella sticks but they were blah.

Just had black burger for the first time and it was so delicious. Their shakes are amazing and we didn't even wait long for our food. Would definitely love to try all their burgers so more reason to come back !

As a west coast transplant, moving to the city meant mad In N Out withdrawals, and I mean, seriously. I tried Shake Shack, I tried Bareburger, I went to random pubs, I searched for any spot I thought might be able to make me a damn good, inexpensive burger, and for months, I was sorely disappointed... until (*dramatic music crescendos*) I found Black Burger. To be fair, it's not as cheap as In N Out, but I appreciate the quality. I wandered into the small joint out of a rainstorm, shivering cold, desperate for a solid burger, and they delivered. Without question, I'll definitely be back.

Good burger at a reasonable price. I had the Swiss burger and the mushrooms and the cheese made a really good combination. I liked the patty as well. The bread, however, was sub par. I paid 7.61 (on the menu as 6.99) after taxes for just the burger.

Although I love the food here- they are VERY unreliable for a late night stop. I've gone here multiple times when they're supposedTo be open and they always have a reason they're closing. Tonight it was an electrical issue - they just close when it's slow. Sucks!!!!!
Ranch burger was really good! Black burger will stay in my top burger list!Burger was cooked perfectly medium, avocado was fresh and they don't skimp on bacon! Burger lovers dream
Wow! Such a good find. First time & won't be last time. Best burgers than a lot of other places. Jerry & H were very kind and were working hard. The food was delicious

Came across this place while walking in soho. The outside of the building speaks for itself. It is very small inside. There are about 7 sits and they are facing the window.I for the Hawaiian burger with curly fries. First off my curly fries were crispy but some of them were burnt. The burger is greasy but it's good. I asked for a medium rare burger and it was over cooked. I was upset about that. But hey it's my first time. I will come back for a second time but not anytime soon.

During my long wait* (may have been dramatized because I was near hangry when I walked in and definitely full on hangry by the time my food came) I thought 4 stars at best. Then I bit into one of best turkey burgers I've had in my entire life and curly fries to be remembered and all my troubles were washed away. Portion size is huge! I mostly ate fries while in the restaurant and saved the burger for later, which was still good on my flight back to Chicago!
A great place to go for a cheap burger in midtown. Very quick despite the lunch rush.

Unfortunately, I did not have a good experience at all with Black Burger. They advertise they use fresh burgers but I question that after my experience with the food. I was in the area for mini golfing at Pier 25 and discovered this place on Yelp to grab a quick bite to eat. I just ordered a plain cheeseburger with fries and upon taking my first bite, I was disgusted. After eating a few bites of the burger, which I would not allow myself to finish, my stomach began to hurt. The burger did not taste fresh at all - it tasted like a frozen patty that was no better than McDonald's. It was basically a low quality fast food burger. If a frozen patty was what I was craving, I could go to McDonalds or Burger King for a fraction of the price for the same quality food. The fries were decent but very greasy. My boyfriend also had the same experience with his bacon burger and we agreed we will not be returning.

Great Burgers. This place is located at a nice location on canal street. Not far from the train station. If you review them on yelp, you are eligible for 3 free mozzarella sticks. Great with your burger. The burger is really yummy but the seating is really tight.
Nice veggie burger option.Not many places have a easy veggie options with regular flavors.

ordered the black burger and it was a very basic burger. not a big fan - i expected the sauce to be something interesting but it was just a mix of ketchup and mayo. the food made me full and satisfied but wasn't enjoyable
Has the best shakes and burgers in town! My favorite is the strawberry milkshake. Would come again :)

Amazing burgers and service! Definitely a must for anyone looking for a great bite before, during, and after some drinks! I got the chipotle burger with pepper jack cheese and it was an unbelievable combination. So many flavors in just one bite. The fries were also bomb! Next time I'll definitely go for their curly fries and onion rings!! Again, highly recommended!!

I was excited to go black burger since the last time I was there about a year ago. I brought my friends to eat there and what was supposed to be a great day turned into a health fiasco. I asked for my burger well done and as you can see in the picture below it was not well done. As a matter of fact it was so undercooked and raw that I could hear the cow mooing. This has not only left a bad impression on me, but the fact that I got food poisoning from this has solidified that this place is not for me.
Great burger great service. Try the salad! I was pleasantly surprised by it. Trying to do no carbs. Everyone so friendly. Tasty as hell.

Was around the area with friends one afternoon and found this place on yelp and decided to try it out. The place had really great reviews so I came in here with some pretty high expectations. It's a really really tiny spots with only a handful of seats available. I ordered a chipotle burger with some extra jalapenos and it wasn't too bad. I had actually ordered the burger medium but received one that was well done. It wasn't the best burger I've ever had but I can definitely see myself coming here hungover, especially because they offer cheese fries. Overall the burger was on the greasy side, which was a real turn off. I would try this place again, but most likely with a nasty hangover.

Great place to grab some quick curly fries and a veggie burger. A bit small so I wouldn't recommend it for a full group, but if you're travelling along chinatown this is usually my first stop before the arduous adventure.

This place is great. The burgers were juicy, the chicken patty was juicy, the curly fries were good and the service was great. My friends and I drove from Brooklyn to Manhattan (deep in Brooklyn) just to get it, on 2 separate occasions. It's a great late night spot.
This place is amazing. Best burgers in the city. Highly recommended. The onion rings and philly burger are amazing!! Def recommend.
Came here for late night dinner. I got the chipotle burger with curly fries and it was bomb. Good food, good price, recommend it.

So I'm a vegetarian, came in starving and late for my next client all the way uptown. Ordered the veggi burger with a soda and fries. Was super excited cause again I'm starving. As I'm watching the burger being made as we all do when starving, I noticed a beef burger being grilled up also. Look I don't mind them together but what gets my bees in my bonnet is using the same spatula on a veggi burger as a meat burger. Man of you would of cleaned it I would be eating that beautifulburger in this damn cab. Instead of eating fries
They're alright.  They ALWAYS forget my pickles on the side tho.  I order them now almost as a joke to see if I'll ever get 'em.  I don't.
Really good burger and curly fries. I could take or leave the shakes but with a consistently good burger its hard to complain about anything.

First gained knowledge of this place from reading reviews, then A few weeks ago while driving on my way Uptown via West Side HGWY I spotted the establishment. So today while in The City, figured I would try them out on my never ending quest of hitting as much as possible Burger Joints!!! I ordered the Black w/cheese well well done lettuce tomato onions pickles mayo & ketchup. Fries & Strawberry Shake.  Your order comes packaged in small little neat box, in which they suggest you use as A plate, by folding diwn the sides. The shake was THICK & Tasty, fries very good and plentiful. The burger while Very G00D was on the small side. Speaking of small, the spot is very SMALL & seating is very cramped and limited. All in all it cost me A little over $16, the experience was worthwhile. When you think of Canal St A raised eyebrow normally follows.......... but this burger joint is Authentic and definitely worth patronizing, like their  borrowed motto, once you go black.............

I think the burgers and fries here are better than at most other places in the neighborhood. One caveat: the staff are sometimes inattentive to the detail on my orders. When I order on line, especially, they tend to ignore my special requests. That's less common when I order in person, but it does also occasionally happen.

Burger is good and fresh tasting.  I'm not a fan of curly fries so hard for me to judge that (I wish they had a regular fries option too).  Reasonably priced ($9 or so for burger fries and soda).  Seating is pretty limited (9 countertop seats in total).  Overall, better than most fast food joints and about the same price.

Fast and friendly service. Ordered two burgers, large fries and a turkey burger (add 75 cents to turn any burger patty into lean turkey meat).Tasty enough, no big surprise on taste. Thought the burgers were a bit small in size.
The curly fries were really good and crispy. I have a chocolate milkshake also that was not too sweet or too watered down. The fires portion was also generous enough. I think I would return!
DELICIOUS, DELICIOUS, DELICIOUS!! They're open late and they're so cheap it's a crime not to indulge late night after drinking and before passing out! ;)

This place is under rated!I eat a lot of burgers and this place is legit. Go for the Double black with cheese, everything on it. They even cook the patties to how u want it, well done, medium or rare.In my opinion this place is better than Shake Shack, In N Out, Five guys or any other fast burger resto.FYI It's not a posh place, but more of a grab n go.Definitely worth a try.

This place is great! Their burgers, curly fries, and milkshakes are all awesome. It's so great to have an affordable GOOD burger place. Great cheeseburger, and the curly fries are awesome and crispy and flavorful. I've had their chocolate shake and their strawberry shake and both are delicious. They used real strawberries and not just syrup, and that's a huge bonus for me.There's not a ton of seating but I've never been there and not been able to find a spot. They have cool decorations, and the people who work there are always friendly. It's a great neighborhood spot!
veggie burger is to die for!!! so good! great customer service and the staff are beyond attentive and very cute as well!! ^_^
This burger was FIRE. Must try if in downtown Manhattan. Chipotle burger and fries were amazing.
My first time at black burger and there is not one bad thing I could possibly say. The burger was so fresh and delicious, and the fries were perfectly crispy. I would recommend to all my friends!
A good quality burger with a good variety of toppings. The curly fries and shakes are really good too.

Great burger, very fast service and people who works here is very friendly. Prices are low compare the tasty burger and amazing curly fries. There are sitting inside and outside. Open 7 days you must try if you haven't so far.
Really quick and great priced burger.Hawaiian burger was on point, little cramped but what isnt in NYC

Best burger in NYC! Here on vacation and stopped in craving a quick greasy cheeseburger, but boy was I pleasantly surprised. This place is definitely quick and definitely greasy BUT the burgers are fresh never frozen, cooked to order however you'd like (well, medium, etc). I ordered a double bacon with cheese and it came with lettuce, tomato, pickle. I also ordered curly fries which were cooked to order as well, everything was super hot and fresh. There was ketchup and some other sauce out for use, the orange sauce was delicious! Would recommend trying this place!!!
The motzarella sticks were delicious. There were many different burger options. I got the classic  black burger, and it was cooked perfectly.

Just got the ranch burger, and it was amazing!! Medium well, was spot on NOT BURNT and it hit the spot perfectly! Im at the perfect point of full just from the burger and im bigger then majority of people.
Great little spot in TriBeCa. Lots of different options, for all kinds of diets and tastes.  Take out to my hotel was super fast.  They also do delivery and Uber eats.

I used UberEATS to order lunch from Black Burger as I was in the mood for a burger. I ordered the Chipotle turkey burger and curly fries. The burger was great, although I didn't realize there would be onions. Either way, it was cooked perfectly and it really hit the spot. I was impressed that it didn't get soggy by the time it arrived. The curly fries on the other hand were just ok... they were a little softer than I was expecting and I didn't feel it was seasoned enough. Not a bad lunch option overall though!
Bad Service, expensive for a quick take out food. Rude staff.
Amazing place, best burger and fries in TriBeCa. The mozzarella sticks are to die for. Open till late!
Black Burger is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC Good service and great food! Definitely a place I'd recommend.
Amazing burgers and amazing curly fries. The service was amazing! The shakes are a delicious and the food is great for the price point. I would recommend for anyone to come here!
Service is great and the food is delicious! Always love coming to Black Burger when I'm in the area!

Probably closer to 3.5 stars seeing as how I come here every other week for lunch. I mostly come here because it is decent value for what you are getting. Black burger does a an ok burger for the price (cheap! ~ $10 for burger and curly fries)The burger itself is nothing exceptional. The curly fries are good.

I would recommend this place. It's not too far from the train station and it is also right on Canal street in the middle of everything. Very easy to get to. The workers are not the friendliest but they're not mean either. So no real complaints there. The speedy service is something that is greatly appreciated. I, generally, only come here on my 30 minute lunch breaks. It takes 5 minutes to walk there and 5 minutes to walk back. It takes about 5-8 minutes to wait for the food so I get about 12-15 minutes to eat which is alright with me.
Good customer service. The philly burger is really good (add jalapenos). My hubby likes the hawiian

Stopped here on a late night, after an event. Had a hankering for a good solid burger. Being too far from my usual, trusted locale it was Black Burger to the rescue. I wasnt expecting much but it was quite good considering my only other option was $1 pizza and some lame fast food joint which shall not be named.I ordered the Texas burger combo with french fries and a fountain soda which came up to slightly over $10. Not bad at all.  The Texas burger comes with bacon,  cheddar cheese and BBQ sauce.  Their placard states that they only use top quality, never frozen angus beef.  It was pretty good and the fries were solid according to my equally ravenous company.  They only sell curly fries which is a Nice touch. Food was made to order--it seemed- so it did take a little bit of a wait.They have a small seating area consisting of about 8-10 outside facing stools and countertops.  It hit the spot and I would definitely return especially considering the options in the area at that time of the Night. No bathrooms were available, FYI.

Asked for a bacon cheeseburger medium well, no tomatoes or pickles. It came out BARELY medium, was very red on the inside. Also NO BACON! Customer service was okay but that's to be expected on canal st. All in all I would recommend against this place. It could be good if the people who worked there payed attention to what they're doing.

I always enjoy ordering from here. Hard to find a decent size burger for less than $7 in New York, or at least the area I am in. Delivery is pretty fast and the fries taste good as well. Comes in a customize Black Burger box which is neat. The only problem I have are the prices for extra topping. I understand making a profit but over a $1.50 (I think) for an egg on the burger? Cmon now.Seems like they started selling their drinks in cups instead of bottles which is pretty cool and I think the cups carries more liquid than the bottles, but the drinks taste a bit...weirder in the cups compared to the bottles. I recommend ordering from this place, but it's better to order in person instead of online so you don't need to spend as much.

I really wanted to like this place. But the reality fell short. Unlike the other hamburger close by with a name that also starts with "black", this place aims for the affordable, high volume output. The main problem I had with this burger was that they claim they're never frozen, but that's what the burger patty tasted like.  It was dense and not cumbly.  So kind of more like a fastfood burger.  The color was more grayish than anything.  And it hardly had any taste in my opinion.  There was nothing special about the bun either.  Overall, it reminded me almost of my elementary school lunch burger.  Not a pleasant memory.  Their fries (curly, seasoned) were good and there was a good amount.  I'm always pulling for the small, underdog places that put out solid, affordable food so I'll try this place again to see maybe if it were just an off day.  Note the place is really small (e.g., ~5 stools) and so much more suitable for takeaway (especially in the summer since it's all open air with no AC).

They always add something to my burger that wasn't asked for whether its ketchup, lettuce, raw onions. The burger's ok. The onion rings are really good, and the Shakes are marvelous.  Its pricey since the move to Canal Street, burger/fries/shake is gonna cost you over $15.
Milkshake: a fantasmic flavor of delicate chocolate with a cool, silky flow of cream. Can't wait for the burger to be ready.

Great food, have came here a few times and really like the burgers. I go a lot for lunch and after school with friends. Never had a problem just really good food.definitely recommend this place. Very good prices.  I would definitely come here again.
Amazing food , curly fries were amazing would recommend to anybody . Cashiers and workers are very friendly and the service was fast! Could use more seating but the service makes up for it .

So I came here on a thursday, pretty busy night. We were hungry and wanted to just eat a burger. Prices looked decent, nothing too expensive so we ordered and waitedand waitedalmost 20 mins of waiting and we got our burgers. Burgers werent fancy or anything, just normal burgers and we dug inProsProbably the closest thing to in-n-out you'll get (or i've found) so far in NYC.Fries are automatically curly fries (win in my book)ConsThe freaking wait. Whats going on 20 mins for a fast food like burger? I understand it was busy but they gotta speed that up somehowIf you're going to offer bacon, make sure the bacon is crispy. Not some tough, semi-soggy bacon. Isn't as good as in-n-out. Bread wasnt crispy enough and tomatoes and ingredients didnt gel as well. Not a fair point at all, but for someone who's from west coast, it tugs on my heartstrings so hard, its similar enough that it makes me homesick, yet not good enough. Thus it makes me sad If you're in the area and dont mind a little wait, this place isnt that bad of a place. I just wouldnt come here because its not fantastic and it makes me miss home ;)

Incredible food all around and a fun atmosphere. I really loved their fries and Reese's shake. Veggie burger was just okay, but the options of toppings made it a great meal. My girlfriend said the burger was "really excellent." You'll just have to take her word for it since I'm a vegetarian.
Great late night spot with quality burger combos and curly fries. Veggie burgers too.
I went back recently and found the food to be much improved. My burger was made exactly to order, the veg was fresh, and a fried egg is now an option. Worthy of another star.

I've been to Black Burger twice for lunch now...and though the line and the small storefront still intimidate me (Where does the line start? Where does the line end? How will i make it to the soda machine in this crowd?), I really do love the burgers and especially the curly fries!For less than $10, I can get a cooked-to-order burger with all the toppings (I like bacon and pickles), plus a small curly fries and a small soda...it's near perfection!

I ordered a turkey burger from here and there were CHUNKS. It was undercooked and flavorless. The staff were OK but they seemed very uninterested in their job. The fries come in VERY TINY portions and are not seasoned.DO NOT RECOMMEND
Amazing burgers!!! Much needed in this neighborhood. Chipotle Burger all the way!The burgers are charred on the outside and perfect in the middle!Curley fries are super tasty.Check it out if you can.

I looooooove burgers. So a few weeks ago, I dropped by Black Burger for the first time and was completely satisfied. I slept good with a full and happy tummy.The orders here are very customizable. You don't eat beef? They got with their Moroccan Burger with lamb meat. No red meat? They got turkey burgers too! Don't wanna a burger? You can get that burger salad to go!
Their burgers are really good. Service was great. I must say they are way better than five guys so if you're in the Tribeca area or roaming through Canal Street definitely try them out!

I try that place by recommendation of a friendAnd woooow......  IT IS  100% best Burger in the area And the price you gotta be kidding me $3.99 for a burger. I got the dobel burger  AND I loved it.  The guy on the frond desk very Ferndly and kind  I would definitely go back

When you walk in the place is no bigger than a studio apartment but the scene is intimate. Cute for a date. The prices  are amazing for Tribeca. The food choices are endless here.  The wait was short. The burger is amazing!!! A must have while in the city

Best burger place near soho. Great prices, burger always taste amazing and they have curly fries! Employees are very nice and always make sure our orders are correct.  Their shakes are amazing as well!
super solid burger, good price. The curly fries are pretty top notch.
Best burger ive had. Every single time im in the city i gotta eat here. Hope to try everything on the menu.

Located on Canal Street, Black Burger recently caught my eye when I was just strolling around and started feeling hungry. I knew I need to get some food for myself since I had nothing in my fridge. What better way to get fed, than to wander around until you find something new! For almost all my life, I could always remember that this location used to be one of those electronic stores with a million cameras in the window. It's funny how now, it is a burger shop! Jon and I followed our noses and found ourselves walking into Black Burger. A very simple restaurant with bar like stools set up around the perimeter, the counter top is strategically covered with the special of the day/ week. The specials are usually some new burger with a side of fries and a drink. The day we walked in, it was the Hawaiian Burger special. We quickly ordered two specials and dived in. I don't know why I ordered the special, because I don't eat that much... I had the regular curly fries and Jon ordered the calamari fries. The fries weren't bad but obviously the burgers are the things to order here! Our Hawaiian Burgers were glazed with a sweet brown sauce and were topped off with a nice juicy slice of pineapple. This is a nice addition to canal street. Quick service and good food at a good price!
Lunch time. Empty and just sat there unattended to. Ended up walking out...something I haven't had to do before.

Got the Black Burger w/ cheese and jalapeño. It's a delicious burger with a thick patty, fluffy buns, and shredded lettuce. They also have Bottle Boylan Soda. Curly fries are nice a crispy too. This place doesn't fit more than 7 people so prepare to stand if you want to eat here.

WoooooowWhy is this across the street from my gym? I'm thankful for it cause it's a great place to eat, but the temptation is real.I had their lamb and feta burger - SO GOOD. Tender, juicy, flavorful. Their curly fries were so golden and crispy and well seasoned, I felt no need for ketchup (and neither did my ketchup loving friend). In the immediate area, this is definitely my favorite place to eat. This is also certainly in my top 5 favorite burgers I've ever had.The prices are great considering the quality and portions (average portion with the burger, above average portion with the fries). I hope they don't raise them.The seating inside is very limited, with 7ish stools facing the window, just so you know.I will definitely return again and again.
Amazing customer service, amazing food love their  milkshake. Definitely my favorite spot
The breakroom burger is in one word...Fire! The pork belly confit is just was the doc ordered on this dish and I love me some eggs on the bun as well. A real class act.

This tiny, trendy, high energy burger joint offers quality burgers, served in cute little boxes; with instructions on how to convert them into a plate.  Opens Sunday after 11:00, sometime.  Has Uber delivery...

I passed by with my boyfriend and we could not resist the aroma of beef burgers wafting from Black Burger. We saw a sign outside advertising their combo of a burger, fries and drink for $6.50...not bad for Tribeca so we stopped and had lunch.Their curly fries were yummy. Their burgers are made to order and dressed up with the works. AWESOME.Please note there is not a lot of seating area at Black Burger..there is just two short counters by the windows with a few seats. There isn't a lot of standing room either. Definitely best eaten right away off the grill.

I went here last week and really really liked it. I don't eat meat so I was happy to see that they had a veggie alternative. I can honestly say that that I had the best veggie burger in my life.It was also less than $6

My family and I were looking to grab something quick to eat and happened to park near this place. The wait was pretty long for our food, around 35 minutes for 3 burgers, and the cashier got my order wrong. That being said, my family really enjoyed the food and want to go back. The amount of food was really filling as well.

This place is amazing! I LOOVE Black Burger!!!! The food is delicious. I enjoy the atmosphere, the ambiance and the community. They really make delicious high quality food for a cheap price. Definitely 5 stars!!!

It is the worst burger I wish I never had. The curly fries who as hard a shoe strings. I love a good burger anf I would pay for it , but I should be paid to eat this. Waste of money a hunger buster will never spend Bother some. This is just my opinion.
Good vibes good burger downtown! I haven't tried the snake yet but I'll get to it next time I'm here.

Good spot to pop in and grab a bite to eat. As you'd guess, burgers and shakes are their speciality. Overall vibe is pretty casual and all of the seats are along the window, so you can people watch while you're eating. It's pretty small, but I didn't have trouble getting a stool. I'd go here if you're in the area, are hungry, and want some food quickly.

I am not a fan of red meal so unless I think the meal is going to be great I just don't bother.But walking down Canal St. and getting catching the fragrance of grilled Angus beef just made my mouth watered.  We had no idea this burger place has opened.The menu choices are simple- burger, double-burger, cheese burger, or bacon burger.Not a hard menu, so it is burger, burger or burger.We went with a combo box (burger, curly fries and soda); burger with the work!  $6.50- delicious burger with caramelized onions, tomato, lettuce, pickles and special sauce.Rate 5/5.Curly fries- crispy and yummy. Rate 4/5.They have shakes on the menu which we did not try.Note: The store is very small and it is a open kitchen format. Counter and ordering area is very tight. The soda dispenser is in the corner and very hard to get to.Inside seating is limited. There are counters along the window but it is very cramp. There are benches out for sitting also.The $1 pizza next door?  Consider it an appetizer.

Tasty juicy n lip smacking satisfaction! I love burgers and was pleased to be nearby when I checked yelp for burger places. Black burger is a tiny joint on canal street; the big sign will lead you there. Was a small crowd so I was able to sit with my meal.I ordered the bacon black with cheese, my go to burger. Love bacon and cheese burgers. The patty was somewhat small, however, it packed a whole lot of taste! I concentrated first on finishing my burger before i tackled the fries. My stomach was pleasantly full at my last bite.The combo deal is $3 more; do it. Comes w a small drink and small fries. The small fries was about the size of a softball; plenty and cooked well. Can't imagine what the large would look like O.O
Burgers are definitely fresh and customer service was great. I called in advance and they had it ready for me so I could beat the lines

Stopped in here after a long day and wasn't expecting too much, just a hot meal to take with me back to the hotel. I don't remember the name of the burger, I just know it was supposed to have a chipotle mayo and I didn't get any chipotle flavor at all. That being said, the burger was actually very good. Cooked just the way I asked for it, flavorful patty, and just big enough. I did get the combo and the curly fries were also really good. The one bummer was that the way they pack the burger into the box is on the side (as many places do) and when I got to the hotel, the cheese had apparently slid to one side of the burger. Guess that tells me it's fresh!A couple of days after dining here I was craving another burger but a check of Yelp told me that this place wasn't open on the weekend. I settled for another burger joint (AOA Bar and Grill) and, boy, was I disappointed. I was doubly disappointed when I went for a walk later only to notice that Black Burger was open for business.
burgers were deadass bomb, my guy. would come again tbh. and the shakes, lordt. those were wow.
My burger was soooo amazing and Caleb was so friendly and insightful with his recommendations . Great place to go before or after a fun night at VIP .
I had a feeling the burger was a bit off- but ate it anyway as I was starving, but within a few hours, I realized that the burger was probably bad-I got a case of food poisoning. Beware
Delicious Burgers, the bun is crispy the house sauce is great and the meat taste really fresh. This is the In and Out Burger of NYC

I went to the other one located on 362 Broadway. Well done. Friendly courteous staff they know their way around a burger even the bacon medium rare ones. ( they give us newbies a chance to decide what we want on our burgers ie:lettuce tomatoes onions, mayo (the standards). One note please bring back the calamari fries. At least once So at least us newcomers to your company can experience the crunchy "squiddy" goodness  of them at least once.
Ordered from uber eats and the burger was extremely dry. I had to drench it with ketchup to add some moisture to it. Absolutely terrible. Reminded me of school lunches

Ehh - not impressed. The burger was tasteless, literally could have been eating air. Which is surprising considering the burger I ordered what supposed to have blue cheese. I asked for medium-rare. It was medium, no pink so that was disappointing. The burgers are thin so I guess no matter how they cook them they are medium or well-done. I drenched it with their sauce, still not much help. The cashier who took my order was also not very nice. Had an attitude and looked pissed when I asked her for something as simple as ketchup. Maybe a smile and a thank you or 'you're welcome' is too much to ask for in the city.The fries, however, is the reason this review has as many stars as it does. They are their only saving grace. In my opinion, good fries are a dime a dozen, but good burgers are hard to come by. And this place ain't it!!!

When Shake Shack is packed and you aren't willing to pay $8 for a decent burger, Black Burger has you covered. A lot of people on Yelp have complained that the conditions are unsanitary but I saw the man cook it up. You can see the kitchen. It's simple but not dirty. As someone who has worked in a dirty kitchen or two, I know the difference. The staff was very nice to me even though I went during prime after school hours. When I asked for the burger medium rare, they had no problem making it that way. They even gave me a handy dandy box to go. The meat is never frozen so that's a plus. The bacon is also top notch and cooked well. Basically, for prices slightly higher than McDonalds, you are getting an above average burger. Great for take out.
Love this place!! Great service, Good food. Only thing I would complain about is the price. Then again its located in downtown Manhattan, expensive is the norm around here.
Gross. Filthy. A colleague of mine got food poisoning and was hospitalized from eating there.

I passed by the place a few days before I went in, it looked busy and figured I found a decent burger spot since the small spot was packed. I went back a few days later and stopped in since I was early for an appointment and thought I'd stop in for lunch. I ordered the bacon black with fries and a drink.I got everything they offered on the burger, including their special sauce. The signs say it was a fresh burger but it took a pretty long time to cook the burger up, especially since it was a pretty thin patty. The burger was all right, not the best fast-casual burger I've had but not the worst either. Their fries were good, crispy and cooked right during my visit. I'm not going to go out of my way to visit again but if I was in the area again and it was time for lunch I'd probably stop by again.

Stumbled into Black Burger one evening while visiting New York. It was the only thing that had an open kitchen. We weren't disappointed though. Great burgers and fries. The staff was really friendly. If I lived in New York, I would go back.

Solid cheap burger with a surprising amount of flavor. I had the Hawaiian burger with curly fries, and it was a much bigger portion for the price than I'm used to in Manhattan. Great food and a great value.

The guys at BlackBurger saved our life - it's 1:30am, my friend and I didn't have dinner, so literally starving, and these saints swooped in and blessed us with beautiful beef patties. I have never posted here before but the patties and the curly fries were without a doubt the best thing to happen to our country.

When I saw this place on Yelp, I thought, "Oh, great, another nondescript, overpriced burger chain." Wrong on all counts! It was quite affordable, delicious, and independent! I got a Black with cheese and "everything" (lettuce, tomato, onions - I asked for mine grilled). It came quickly and I wolfed it down without a second thought.If you're ever in the area, and need something quick (and aren't feeling Chinese food), stop by. It's worth it.

Really great veggie burgers--they actually have really vegetables in them instead of frozen, pulverized soy like most places. Get the Philly burger; it'll melt your face off with ooey-gooey deliciousness.
Food is great! But please ask them to place a the regular size cup next to the large. There isn't a huge difference. Same goes for large fries. There is no incentive to upsize your combo.

I was headed on a road trip late night and was starving. I was skeptical for some reason to eat here but odor anyway and what a good decision that was. The burger was crazy good and my curly fries were sick too. Def grab a burger here. The menu has a burger for everyone.

Tons of different burgers and shakes. Haven't had the burgers but gotta say the curly fries and shakes are amazing. The fries are the best I've had in a long time. Flavorful, crispy on outside and bit soft on the inside. It is a really small place with a couple of stools facing canal st. Grab a snack and get back to shopping in soho within walking distance
This is a nice place to go to if you want a quick meal to go...The burger was alright. When I want a burger at a decent price I will go here.
Amazing burger. My number one stop when I visit NYC. Highly recommend it for street food. The curly fries are amazing too

This is the BEST burger in NYC (way better than Shake shack) and the special sauce is amazing! They also always have speedy service and the best customer service - their manager even delivered me a chocolate milkshake personally after it was forgotten. I LOVE BLACK BURGER!

Ordered on Seamless 3 times, and never again. First 2 times forgot my extra drink; when I asked in the instructions to please include my drink, I got my order (without my drink of course) with a USED BABY PACIFIER IN THE BAG. When I called to complain whoever was on the other line hung up. Worst customer service and delivery experience ever.
Great tasty burger for cheap! I got the extra egg addon for 1.50. Place is small but the burgers are quite juicy. Definitely give it a try.

I read the reviews for Black Burger before I went in. They didn't seem that great, so I decided to steer clear of the burger. And head straight to the curly fries.I've been back 4 times. The fries are really great, I can't wait to try the milkshakes.

This place was great! We checked it out because of the location and its stellar reviews. We were not disappointed. It's a hole in the wall (which I guess much of the city is) but man oh man, the burgers are awesome. We loved the sayings on the walls and the fun menu items (spinach and tomato grilled cheese anyone? Because winning is best with food). My group had the Texas, the Black w/cheese and the Chipotle and fries. Each person was very pleased. The burgers were all juicy but not greasy, seasoned well, on point medium rare and done in just a few minutes. One of our group is gluten free and can't even look at bacon grease - the guys were sure to wipe down the cooktop before making her food and she was happy. Go here to be happy.
Been here a few times and the burgers here is out of this block! What is Mcdonald or Burger King when you have this place here?!
One of the best burger spots downtown. Fresh, fast, and made to order at a fair price. Sounds like a commercial haha but that's exactly what it is. Get the "black burger combo with cheese."

So I love Black Burger! I've been coming here since I started going to school on Canal street .. When I tell you that the food is fresh.. I've never had anything less than or anything that I had to take back and j can't say that about too many restaurants.. The cashiers/cooks are always nice! If you come here please make sure you try the "special sauce" it's usually by the counter if someone isn't holding it hostage because it's so great! This restaurant's burgers and fries are veryyyyy tasty and it's hard to find that in the city! As an update.. If you come in and do a yelp review, you get a prize... But I'm not telling you guys what it is! You gotta visit

This little place is so convenient. Servers are quick and efficient. I came here on my lunch break and even with a line, I was able to order and receive my order no more than fifteen minutes. Not to mention, their burger is is juicy to the perfection because it's never frozen. A must try especially if you got that burger crave!
Good, fresh, and did I mention good?Definitely worth a visit if you are around and not super expensive. The location is small doesnt have many seats, but the food is good.

I've been to Black Burger twice and what I really like about the place is that the burgers are tasty and extremely affordable. If I could, I'd give them 3.5 stars.I've had their black with cheese and chipotle burgers. Both were delicious and I was surprised that they were able to cook them medium-well (slightly pink in the center). The burgers are about $4-$6 which is great.Others have commented on this - but I love their curly fries! You can get house sauce or ketchup on the side and I'm a fan of the cute packaging of their meal items (burger + fries in a cardboard to-go box). Definitely good for a quick bite or lunch to-go.
Must say one of the best burgers I've had in the city. Also for the price it's unbeatable. Might I add I love seasoner curly fries and thats what they include with the meal combo.

Go here, don't wait in a line at Black Tap Burger. Around $10 you get a great burger, curly fries and a drink (they have bottled soda too). Their milkshakes are on point too. The only thing I will say is when you order any of the specialty burgers/chicken sandwiches, ask for extra sauce, you'll need it to really get the flavor the cook is going for.
When there for lunch today, heard their burger was good. Their attitude was so bad, never going there again. Doesn't matter how good the food is when their attitude is so bad.
This place rules ! Good milkshakes ! Good burgers and reasonable pricing Quick and easy meal deffinetly recommend black burger!

Meh, there's not much to say about this place. I ordered a Texas burger that was pretty decent, the sauce had a nice kick to it which was great. And it was overall an ok burger. But when I eat a burger I want it bursting from flavor, not only from the burger but from the toppings as well. It was lacking. The cheddar on the burger also lacked flavor. To top it off the curly fries that came with it tasted like the industrial ones that they sell in baseball stadiums. Fried to hell, greasy and covered with the off brand seasoning salt. I wanted to like Black Burger a lot more but...meh
Really good burger. Small little space. Staff really nice. It was cooked just right. And it was a nice spot to find walking from the 9-11 memorial
Pretty good philly burger, and it was only $6.50. The buns were good, but fell apart easily. As previous reviews said, it's a good quick bit. Friendly staff, which is always appreciated.

Best burgers in the area!Cheap prices for delicious juicy burgers!Staff is really friendly, giving a nice warm vibe to the small burger shack. Highly recommend the curly fries, and the shakes are also delicious. Thumbs up.

Great location. Friendly service.  Cheat eats for under $10. Black Burger was a nice surprise after a long afternoon in Soho; walking down W. B'way toward TriBeCa crossing Canal; its street level entrance invites you in. The menu is simple: burger, double burger or burger w/cheese. Although its not noted on the menu I had a turkey burger topped w/raw onions, sliced tomatoes, pickles, dressed w/a mayo-like sauce combo (curly fries & soda) all served in cool looking take away upright box.  The burger with its toppings was classic-juicy-running-down your-wrist delicious.  Enjoy.

Stumbled upon this while I was driving -- literally hadn't eaten all day, and there was a parking space right in front, so it called to me...And boy am I glad it did!  Totally fresh ingredients, delicious burger, soft bun -- technically fast food, but far more delicious and less greasy and gross than typical fast food fare.  Curly fries have never been my favorite, but these were delicious.  And everyone who worked there was super nice.A few disclaimers:  This is NOT a real eat-in place; there are maybe 6 seats inside, all stools facing the windows.  And there're no restrooms.  But if you just need a drive by, outstanding burger, this place can't be beat!
Great customer service, fries are really good !! Fast and efficient, right around soho so come when you're tired of shopping for a quick bite!
Typical fast food joint in a tiny sliver of a triangle storefront. Nothing special and so many people there's not really room to sit and eat.

Special, nothing off with coupon! No really get. Combo with burger, fries and a drink for $6.95 for a buck more large size drink and fries.  Great burgers 100% Angus beef cooked to order and nice crispy fries. Order to go or sit on a stool and chow down. This is a no frills place. Also serving turkey and veggie burgers.   Rated "A" by NYC.

Black Burger left my heart black with grief. Clearly, New York City in general has no idea of what a good burger looks like, tastes like etc etc. The meat was tasteless, the toppings were mindless. The patties were chewy and clearly overcooked. There was watery stuff drippings out of the mushrooms. I mean, when you put grilled mushrooms on a burger at least make sure they're not dripping liquids everywhere. The only thing worth eating in my meal were the curly fries and oh well, I'm sure they got delivered to them from the back of a Sysco truck. Avoid this place unless you are drunk and won't remember it.
Quick easy and delicious. Obviously not the best burger in nyc but for a quick greasy fix it definitely did the job. Got the chipotle burger and a shake. Nom.
I've had a lot of veggie burgers before...this one was good. Definitely not the greatest, but definitely good. Whatever it lacked they made up for in the curly fries. Delish!

I went to the Black Burger location at 362 Broadway and got the Swiss Burger (with beef) and curly fries and paid $9.78: $5.99 for the burger and $2.99 for the fries. The fries were good, but the beef burger was horrible, made of low quality beef. The mushrooms that came with the burger were from the can. Altogether, I can say the meal was not worth $9.78. Arome Café and even burger King and McDonalds have similar quality burger meals, if not better, but for less. My suggestion to the owner is stick with what you know, i.e., $1 dollar pizza.

The place was tiny but had a great look so I decided to grab an early dinner. Because I'm a vegetarian--and I didn't see that they have veggie burgers until after I ordered--I got the tomato and spinach grilled cheese. BIG MISTAKE. The spinach is not fresh. It's basically thawed out birdseye frozen crap. It tasted awful and did not go with the sandwich, which improved a lot once I scraped off the clumps of spinach. I'm willing to try the veggie burger and fries and shake, but before I do I had to leave this negative review because why would you do that to a grilled cheese? What a baffling choice.
Quick easy delicious burgers with veggie and turkey substitutes available - I recommend the mozzarella sticks and the curly fries!

Top notch veggie burgers (among the best I've had in the city), friendly staff, amazing milkshakes. Fries aren't bad but aren't amazing. I can't comment on the meat because I don't eat it. You're looking at $15 for a burger, side and drink but it's worth it.Not a lot of space to dine in but who cares?

Black burger is unbelievable. I'm new to the city and always trying to find good spots. This is top 5 my favorite. How about getting a free milk shake with your combo. You can not beat that. & I love milk shakes. They are outstanding. I will come here again for sure.

Black Burger is a small burger shop located on a small island offline canal street. If you're ever on Canal and in the mood for a tasty burger this place will satisfy. They advertise 100% Angus meat, and although I'm not a fan of Angus, the meat was tasty nonetheless. They also have Calamari Fries, which seems a little odd but it wasn't bad at all. This place seems to have mystery items on the menu as I had no idea they had "curly" fries, but when I saw them making it in the back and asked about it, the lady behind the counter confirmed. So if I ever go again, i'll try to ask for something special.Black Burger has a humorous decor. On the walls you'll see "Get 2 Burgers for the Price of 2 special!" and "Vladimir Puttins favorite burger place!" Black Burger has a lot of variety, and is def worth a stop by if in need of a burger off Canal.
Fresh juicy burgers! Must try fir burger lovers. They don't have fancy burgers, but it does hit the spot! Super friendly staff!
I love this place! Amazing burgers and even better curly fries! It's super quick and easy to get on a lunch break.
GREAT customer service will be recommending to all my friends!!!! Smells delicious and great deals
Good vegan burgers. Plus I got a free milkshake with this yulp review ; ) great customer service wi the a smile. I just hope they are being paid well. Cause customers sometimes give them hell.
